Blog.post: ... and suddenly the rain comes down... "here comes the rain again, falling on my head like a memory...." Memory from New Mexico in 2003... Beautiful!! urlLink Boarding Pass

I enjoyed the visit to New Mexico incredibly lots! It was a trip with lots of activities and curious things I never seen before! We were driving in the middle of the desert when the storm came to us and not a single person around us... Before that, we stop to take this picture of the only vertical object I found on the horizon... A small house - toilet looking - in the middle of nowhere... Love it! Places where the time stops... urlLink Boarding Pass
mm... Another photo of my mom... :) urlLink Boarding Pass

This is a little tiny correction for my previous blog for those who like to spot mistakes when a brain is about to collapse when is writing. When I write "Scavenger's Hunt of last night" I meant... -> Scavenger's hunt of last YEAR! Got to remember what I did last night and why is it so subliminal!! hahaha!!! * * * * * * Art is the human behaviour - www.juliana.nu http://julianaforero.blogspot.com/

One of my very favorites!!! Here it comes!!! Almost a year ago I took this pic in New Mexico! Que cosa tan bacana, oiga!? The desert was just mine (should I say the dessert? :D) I printed this picture to Pablo, another artist and friend who seems to like this print very much, I also give away another print in the Scavengers Hunt of last night... so if the person who took it recognize it... it certainly needs a signature -> mine!! I travelled with my boyfriend Serge, and it was such a great trip! I loved it! I am starting to feel that pictures calls my eyes whenever they want to be shot. (is there another verb for that?) Quien sabra? Quizas Mandrake, no? A ver a ver!? urlLink Boarding Pass

Ladies and gentlemen... Let me introduce to you... my mom!!! We traveled north to West Palm Beach to do some work there, and.. I found the beach sooo appealing that I asked her to walk with me there... As usual I had my camera on me so she posed for me... And here it is... One year later, almost exactly ;) enjoy! urlLink Boarding Pass

Que ahora me acompaÃ±a Toto la momposina en el fondo... y siento que mis caderas quieren bailar mientras mis ojos quieren dormir... Tengo que apagar a Toto y ponerme en posicion horizontal prontito! *Ay Petronita... la arena me va a matar... ya me duele la cintura que no puedo matar....* tambor tambor * lalalala *

Just like that, no edition, no nothing... That is 1 block west of my work! Next to it there is a mall, a spa and a hotel, but at 1 am most of the lights are not close and the only thing I see when I am driving back home at midnight is this turn sign... urlLink Boarding Pass

Ahhh... today I am happy so I am posting this one too!! I was walking with my spanish friend Miriam in Pompano Beach while having an ice cream when I saw this photo in my mind. We stop and took this one and then carry on sipping ice cream and walking forward, while calming down the burned skin!!! urlLink Boarding Pass

I am back!!!! With over 400 pictures!!! So, expect some nice little additions on the walls. I might start also publishing some New York pictures while I am editing them... Keep visiting for more! This one is close to the RiverFront and Las Olas Blvd in Fort Lauderdale. I will keep posting all kinds of photos from the places I've been... Cheers!!! urlLink Boarding Pass

I thought I published this photo earlier but... I don't see it... so, here it goes again!!! Tomorrow I will be flying to New York City... so the immediate effect is that I won't be able to publish any photographs while I am gone... ("nomada" my computer will relax at home ;) ) But the effect at the LONG TERM effect is that most probably I will come with many interesting pictures to publish! So.... this 'suffering' is for the best of all ;) hehe... This photo has enlighten many people's browser, yet I am still publishing it here because many others haven't seen it yet.... mmm... I don't remember over which sky I took this pic, most probably over New Mexico... Enjoy my Window Seat Pic.. for the n time! "I'll be back!" urlLink Boarding Pass

This is somewhere over New Mexico or Texas... The original size of the picture allows you to actually SEE a train on the top middle of the photograph. I took this one from plane very high in the clouds... I love this photograph! Enjoy it! urlLink Boarding Pass

One day I went with my friend Lina to the Main Library, and I loved the view from the elevator, so simple, geometric and very difficult to avoid the simetry... so I took several pictures of the parking lot and this is the one I love the most from that day. One sunny day of 2003 in a parking lot. urlLink Boarding Pass

What can I truly say about this pic? I saw this Gallo Loco walking like a PRO in the streets of Key West. When he saw me he run to the middle of the street and started doing this cat-walk show for me.. "I am too sexy for this street, yeaaahh" urlLink Boarding Pass

How about a nice little walk in Key West? I found this houses so warm and inviting that they couldn't escape from my camera... I am too knackered to tell the whole story though. Nice little white houses... urlLink Boarding Pass

I just finished editing a couple of photographs I haven't thought of publishing in my blog, plus some pics I took on Tampa this monday... And I have in total more than 80 to share with you! So, keep on visiting because as I promised I am uploading more and more everyday ;)

mmm.. Nada mas relajante que conducir por 2 horas sobre el mar... this one is going to Key West... un puente de no se cuantas millas... y ni me pregunten en kilometros.. pero es mucho tiempo conduciendo a 50 millas per hour.... oh lala.. en fin... Cielo Azul, Mar Azul, un par de postes y un Cayo al fondo... mm... urlLink Boarding Pass

Vale, a peticion del publico (gracias Roberto!) va una foto a estas horas de la noche. La historia de esta es bien sencilla. Sonaban las 9 de la noche un dia de mis epocas "nature's touch" y le tome esta foto a la fuente que mas me gustaba del almacen... El sonido del agua es tan relajante... habia gente que me preguntaba si haciamos masajes!!! jjaja!! NO SEÑORA, NO MADAME. urlLink Boarding Pass

One day I was taking out Tomas (my dog... or should I say the dog of the family...) for a walk, when I saw this egg laying in the ground. There are always ducks walking around my house and this egg was sooo much inviting me to take a picture, like posing, that I had to run back home and grab the camera (hoping no animal would eat it first).. What happened with it afterwards? Well, perhaps he was never born, perhaps he did and it's walking around my house, it might went flying somewhere less hot... I hope it didn't went exploring the shadow of a car - like many of the ducks here do, and then end up visiting places unvoluntarily with it. urlLink Boarding Pass

I don't know if they already finished this bridge, I assume they did... I was driving north to drop a photograph for a group exhibition in Palm Springs Gardens... It was such a long unexpected drive that I had to stop in a Holiday Inn to go toiletting... Never been there twice. urlLink Boarding Pass

Aqui el correo es la maravilla! Soy una adicta no solo de mi correo electronico sino tambien del correo normal! Y hay veces en las que ni siquiera me llegan las ofertas de AOL No credit card required... Buahhh!! Se olvidaron de mi los amigos y las culebras!! Me alegro? jaja! Ese es mi famoso 10769! urlLink Boarding Pass

This is how marsians looks in my imagination! Though usually I see them like "street lights"... Otro atardecer en la Florida, saliendo del trabajo por la I-95... de Boca Raton a la casa... en el 2002 urlLink Boarding Pass

Un dia ibamos con mi hermana por la I-95, saliamos del trabajo y vimos el atardecer... En el cielo un avion estaba escribiendo algo como: "God loves you, love God"... Se confunde con las nubes y el cielo azul... Quizas para los que buscan una respuesta en el "cielo", pues literalmente encontraran ahi... y podran decir "esta escrito!!!" En verano este avion suele escribir en el cielo una variedad de mensajes cristianos sobretodo. urlLink Boarding Pass
Not 100% sure if I added this picture in the blog... One day with my mom we came accross this street in Coral Gables, and I happened to have my camera!! ;) urlLink Boarding Pass

Someone asked me is this picture was a building... I GUESS NOT!! This is a lovely bucket with water with a tadpole somewhere hidden, the sunset is reflected in its water and behind.. the lake... Lovely Floridian Sunset... This photo was exhibited in Palm Beach Gardens Show in 2002, together with a group of fellow artists. urlLink Juliana
This picture is in a parking lot in Boca Raton, back in 2002. I love it!! urlLink Juliana
So, the first two photographs were taken in Florida, in 2002 * * * * * * Art is the human behaviour - www.juliana.nu

Well, my online photography exhibition only holds 9 photographs per exhibition, and the one currently in progress called "Boarding Pass" has a tiny little bit more (and increasing) quantity, so I have chosen to try to post them here to see how it works. urlLink Juliana

Today I started uploading my upcomming Photography Exhibition Online from my travel experiences. The website only allows me to upload one photograph at a time... so, I believe it will take me about a week to finish the setup. In the meantime I will upload here some of them. Here it goes the first one... urlLink Juliana
I am learning how to add pictures to my blog, in the meantime this is me in West Palm Beach on a sunny day no too long ago. urlLink Juliana
This is what I can do at 1 am in the morning while waiting for the dreamtime to come and take me.

Alright!! Last picture before I vanish to the airport!!! Not too long ago in New York I used to see this image over and over.... Looooove this photograph!!! See you in a week and a half when a new picture is due :) Cheers to everybody!!! urlLink Boarding Pass

Ahhh... 2 weeks ago I went to New York City for the first time... I loved it! This is the Hudson river from New Jersey with Manhattan in the back... Looks like the path to success (LOL!). The next week I will be exploring the lands of the Grand Canyon in Arizona and Utah, so, again, I won't be able to publish any new photography until I come back from there. Most probably next week... I hope you enjoy the ones that are already published. I am going to miss this blog for a little while... I am getting used to this duty of posting one photography everyday... Cheers!!!! urlLink Boarding Pass

I loved the dessert!! Here, for example... Who would drive about 2 hours (at 90mph) to pick up the mail... in the middle of nowhere!! Even better: which postman would like to drive 2 hours (at least) to reach this mailbox.. which will be probably empty for.. God knows how many years... Ahhh, in a sentence: this mailbox created many philosophical questions about Life for me!! urlLink Boarding Pass

Can it be more convenient? After hours of driving in the desert and no tree to hide, you find this practical portable toilet that will provide you personal satisfaction and relief in the more harsh conditions. My personal satisfaction was to take a photograph of it and smile all the way to the Hotel due to the discovery :) Desert in New Mexico. urlLink Boarding Pass

Carlsbad Caverns... A phone underground, that was the signal that way below I was going to find an underground shopping place!! A fastfood place and a kiosk selling T-shirts... Was rather a sad view but I have to admit I had fun taking this pic! urlLink Boarding Pass

Ahhh, the VERY first time I went to Mexico City I took this pic. I absolutely love it! Brings me good and not so good memories... I love it! This is in the Museo de Antropologia and if I remember properly, this is El Arbol de la Vida... If someone could correct me on this please feel free!!! Another pic to the record :D urlLink Boarding Pass

I will send an photograph with my signature with the first person who tells me where is my boyfriend in this picture. I know, this is a very hard one. Memory from New Mexico up in the Sandia Peak -> that name makes me thirsty! urlLink Boarding Pass

Yeah!!! I could see very far from there!!!! This is the view of the rest of New Mexico from the Sandia Peak in Albuquerque.. a romantic place to play "where I've been" at the end of the trip! hehe.. Well, I like this picture and since I am such in a good mood BECAUSE IT'S MY BIRTHDAY (!!!)) I might publish another picture later today. Forgot to mention I have to pack everything in boxes for my moving to Tallahassee in 2 weeks. Yaiks! hehe urlLink Boarding Pass

Ok, now I will send you a mental image! I had a surprise Birthday celebration tonight and that left me very very happy. I am turning one year old today, thought if you think properly.. it was during a year that tonight after 2 hours of August 4th. I am one year older and I feel good about it. I have many things going on and among my gifts I saw an ironing board and a microwave -> I am moving alone in the next 2 weeks and I have to buy many household items, as well as packing many things!!! Life is great and has to be lived -> I change my motto everyday, but basically I keep smiling at life because it has been great. So, keep on visiting my pages and don't forget you can post your comments as anonymous if you don't want to register with the blog people. Keep on smiling, I say Happy Birthday to me! * * * * * * Art is the human behaviour - www.juliana.nu http://julianaforero.blogspot.com/

Que tan practico!!! Una caneca en el desierto!!! Faltaba mas! Me ha parecido tan... tan... no tengo palabras que esta foto es de mis favoritas... Le tome en realidad unas 20 fotos a tan maravillosa vista que fue dificil escoger la mejor... Bienvenidos al primer mundo señores! Where everything has been planned for your personal satisfaction. Una caneca en el desierto!!!! En realidad.. I've seen it all! But wait, there is more to come ;) urlLink Boarding Pass
Ahh, when I think about there are also many friends that are not part of my photographies... And some that don't even know I have a photo of them! urlLink Boarding Pass

What can I say! It would be impossible if the people around me wouldn't be part of what I do somehow. Usually my family and friends are behind the shooting (usually because I don't want them to mess us my idea :D, or I need them to push some algas on the sea for a video :D - I know I sound evil :D ), but as much as we love eachother they ARE the subject of many of my photographs and I couldn't be more proud to show you my boyfriend for the past 5 years: Serge, in this picture. This one was shot one year ago on the trip we did to New Mexico. On one of the dunes of White Sands here he is. And well, for the many people who have heard of him.. well, here it is a tiny look! jaja urlLink Boarding Pass
